Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey in section, the interior is slightly grooved and covered with a cream-coloured deposit, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.78)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (372010) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/372010)
